page.title: 09Scouting in rural areas
page.content:
Scouts flourish in this part of Kent. {West Kingsdown}have a particularly successful{Group}with{two Cub Packs and{two Scout Troops.} The dispersed nature of the village does not affect the widespread support the Group enjoys.
The{Group}has its own{Headquarters,}a prefabricated building donated by a local businessman. It is sited in woodland, adjacent to the Anglican Church. The{Group}though, is an{Open {Group}with no particular religious affiliation.
There is no Scout Group meeting in Ash. This is covered by{Ash Green {Scout Group,}which{embraces}both{Ash and{New Ash Green,}to the north. All the three Cub Packs and two Scout Troops meet in halls in New Ash Green.
